alert.note: Alert for Clay (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 27 at 8:37PM CDT until April 29 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Buffalo River near Hawley affecting Clay County. .Water levels continue to drop across the Buffalo River, and in Hawley levels drop below Flood Stage by tomorrow. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Buffalo River near Hawley. * WHEN...Until early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, MINOR FLOOD STAGE. Parts of Hawley City Park begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 8.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 PM CDT Wednesday was 8.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow morning and continue falling to 6.2 feet Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
